definition: alarm (e.g. burglar or fire alarm)/warning device

sentences.english: Each room is equipped with smoking detection system.
sentences.chinese: 酒店每間客房均設有煙感報警器。

sentences.english: The taping of the magnets was the final step.
sentences.chinese: 解決磁鐵報警器是最後一步。

sentences.english: The white shark flag was raised and the siren set off.
sentences.chinese: 同時升起了白鯊旗並按響了報警器。

sentences.english: Just as he leaves, the infrared alarm burps.
sentences.chinese: 正當他離開時，紅外線報警器響了。

sentences.english: SECURITY. Reverse alarm neutral start switch handlever parking brake.
sentences.chinese: 倒車報警器，空擋啓動開關，手動駐車制動。

sentences.english: She has even bought me a " Pervert Alarm".
sentences.chinese: 不過她有老孃買給她的防變態報警器挖哈哈。

sentences.english: A full time security guard sounds expensive. Why don't they just put in an alarm system?
sentences.chinese: 全職保安聽上去很貴的。他們爲什麼不裝個報警器呢？

sentences.english: A telephone alarm device is designed with the Public Switched Telephone Network as a medium.
sentences.chinese: 設計了一種利用公共通信網作媒介的電話自動報警器。

sentences.english: All of them rushed for the exit as soon as they heard the alarm.
sentences.chinese: 聽到報警器響他們都向太平門衝去。

sentences.english: A new type Annunciator is put forward in order to avoid disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 爲克服以上不足，提出一種新型剩餘電流報警器。

sentences.english: They slip out as Tuxhorn resets his alarm.
sentences.chinese: 在塔克斯宏重設報警器之前溜了出來。

sentences.english: A good security company alarms the window over the sink.
sentences.chinese: 一個好的安全公司會把報警器裝在水槽上的窗戶上。

sentences.english: C. Test alarm of every safety shower and eyewash station.
sentences.chinese: 測試每個安全噴淋和洗眼器的報警器。

sentences.english: This paper introduces a design of one power sup- ply of fire annunciator.
sentences.chinese: 本文講述一種火災報警器電源設計。

definition: to return something to its rightful owner
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
see 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]
